## The Data

-   Mount Vesuvius Dataset from Tidy Tuesday (May 13, 2025)

-   The data contains records of seismic activity at or near Mt. Vesuvius, Italy over the last decade or so

-   Source: <https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2025/2025-05-13/readme.md>

## Question 1

**How have the frequency and depth of seismic events at Mount Vesuvius changed over time?**

-   This section of the presentation reviews the seismic events' behavior over time
-   The following plots are used to analyze the Duration Magnitude and the Depth of the seismic events
    -   Line plots
    -   Histograms
    -   Error plots

## Approach

1.  Any NaN were removed for the Duration Magnitude and the Depth

2.  The data was smoothed by calculating the average of the Duration Magnitude and the Depth per year & month

3.  The time had to be wrangled to remove undesired characters

## Question 2

**How does the depth of seismic events relate to their magnitude? Are deeper events more powerful?**

-   \<Add stuff here\>

## Approach

-   The first step was to remove bad (or missing) data by dropping rows with NA in `latitude`, `longitude`, `depth_km`, and `duration_magnitude_md`
-   The first step was to down-sample the raw depth data into levels only depth boundaries spanning 0.5 km bands, creating a new variable titled `depth_boundary_0.5km`, plotting in ascending depth order meaning that deeper values will appear first
-   A size re-scaling for points was created from this new depth layer variable
